text: hi my name is Matt wood and I'm the
general manager for artificial
intelligence at AWS it's important to
understand what facial recognition is it
makes predictions not decisions it
allows you to look at a set of faces and
compare them to a data set of other
faces and see if there's a match facial
recognition technology significantly
reduces the amount of time it takes to
identify people in photos and video
which makes it a powerful tool for
business purposes but also for law
enforcement and government agencies to
catch criminals prevent crime and find
missing people we've already seen the
technology used to materially benefit
society to prevent human trafficking
reunite missing children with their
parents improve the physical security of
a facility by automating access and
moderate offensive and illegal imagery
posted online for removal our
communities are safer and better
equipped to help in emergencies when
they have the latest technology in their
toolkit we understand why people are
concerned about facial recognition
we can send about it to Amazon leaders
even when they're not at work spend a
lot of time on issues of equality
that's why we've talked to customers
researchers academics policymakers and
others to understand how to best balance
the benefits of facial recognition with
the potential risks and we believe it's
critical that any legislation protects
civil rights were also allowing for
continued innovation and practical
application of the technology those
discussions led to the development of
our proposed guidelines for the
responsible use of the technology and we
encourage policy makers to consider
these guidelines as potential
legislation facial recognition should
always be used in accordance with the
law including laws that protect civil
rights when facial recognition
technology is used in law enforcement
human review is a necessary component to
ensure that the use of a prediction to
make a decision does not violate civil
rights when facial recognition
technology is used by law enforcement
for identification or in a way that
could threaten civil liberties a 99%
confidence score threshold is what we
recommend
law enforcement agencies should be
transparent in how they use facial
recognition technology there should be
noticed when video or facial recognition
technology are used together in public
or commercial settings we believe our
customers including law enforcement
agencies and other
groups working to keep our communities
safe should have access to the best
technology in the two years since we've
been offering Amazon recognition we have
not received a single report of misuse
by law enforcement and we've seen it
used for a lot of societal good if
anyone is concerned that the service is
being misused they can report it and we
will investigate every report our
customers are responsible for following
the law in how they use the technology
we prohibit customers from using any AWS
service including Amazon recognition to
violate the law including civil rights
laws and customers who violate the law
will not be able to use our services we
also provide clear guidance to users and
recommend using a high confidence
threshold in scenarios where highly
accurate facial matches are important
such as an investigation and even then
recommend it be used as just one piece
of a human driven decision like any
other piece of evidence we will continue
to work with partners across industry
government academia and community groups
on this topic because we strongly
believe that facial recognition is an
important even critical tool for
business government and law enforcement
use
